instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
Hi Macbook  came in No spillage with short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> after removing and replacing <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> short is gone. The board draws up to 680ma then drops to 340ma. Chipmunk usb activity led shows activity on usb. but black screen. (also tried known good screen)
L8030 1.2V
L7960 .95V
L7900 1V
L8060 1V
L7370 .85V
L7220 .55V
L7210 .55V
L7430/20/10    0V    2ohm resistance.
L7330 1.05V
L7030 13V
L8410 0V
L7690 3.3V
L7670 5V.

What signal area would I check now?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
Did you test external video?
How did the problem appear?

Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines of J8500.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 680ma no display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 101663, member: 682"]
Did you test external video?
How did the problem appear?

Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines of J8500.
[/QUOTE]
Hi yes I meant to mention no external video apologies. All diode reading are good.
When I got it, I fixed the initial issue which was <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> then upon testing found where I am at now.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 680ma no display
threads.message: Just in case, try known good, clean ME BIOS.
